It features small, hairy leaves and produces clusters of pale yellow to greenish-yellow flowers. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with medicinal properties. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
